title: Union for Europe
text:
The Group Union for Europe (UFE) was a <a href="Conservatism">conservative</a> <a href="Political%20groups%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">political group</a> with seats in the <a href="European%20Parliament">European Parliament</a> between 1995 and 1999. The group was formed during the <a href="Fourth%20European%20Parliament">4th European Parliament</a> term in July 1995 from a merger of the <a href="European%20Democratic%20Alliance">European Democratic Alliance</a> and <a href="Forza%20Europa">Forza Europa</a> parliamentary groups, becoming the third largest group by number of <a href="Member%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">MEP</a>s. The group was succeeded in the <a href="Fifth%20European%20Parliament">5th European Parliament</a> by the <a href="Union%20for%20Europe%20of%20the%20Nations">Union for Europe of the Nations</a> (UEN), while
key UFE member parties <a href="Forza%20Italia">Forza Italia</a> and <a href="Rally%20for%20the%20Republic">Rally for the Republic</a> instead joined the <a href="European%20People%27s%20Party%20%28European%20Parliament%20group%29">European People's Party</a>.
